list_definition.definition: without letting people know who one is, eg by using a false name

list_ex_of_english: They would prefer to be incognito than enfranchised.
In another interview we were told that he intends to travel incognito on the trains and tubes.
Information about these events travelled by word of mouth (as well as the newly popular mobile phone) between clubbers who were obliged to party incognito.
Who better than him to surpass the incognito signified in my girl of the cord?
They are to devote more of their time to work on passenger ships and carry out many more spot and incognito checks than before.
We should not he able to do this if we went incognito.
The only way to make proper investigations was to go incognito.
The vehicle inspectorate also makes incognito visits to testing stations; follows up complaints about stations; and checks vehicles at the roadside.
